isis.stitle: Side Mount Cooling Package - RE Bus - REMOVE AND INSTALL PROCEDURES - HYDRAULIC PUMP

step1.para: Unlatch and open the rear compartment service doors, left-side door, and rear door.
Insert ratchet in belt tensioner release hole, relieve tension from drive belt, and remove drive belt from hydraulic pump pulley.
Remove six bolts and washers from the hydraulic pump pulley.
Remove the hydraulic pump pulley from the hydraulic pump.

note.para: Cap and plug all hoses upon removal to stop leakage and prevent contamination.

step1.para: Place a suitable container under the lower hydraulic hose to catch the hydraulic oil from the system.
Remove P-clips and wire ties as needed from the lower hydraulic hose.
Disconnect the lower hydraulic hose from the hydraulic pump and position lower hydraulic hose into the container for draining.
Disconnect the upper hydraulic hose from the hydraulic pump.

caution.para: The hydraulic pump weighs 77 lbs. (35 kg) and care should be taken when removing the hydraulic pump. The temperature sensor and wiring located under the hydraulic pump can be broken if the hydraulic pump is allowed to drop down.

important.para: To aid in removal of the hydraulic pump, remove two bolts from the pulley end mount holes, install two 8 mm studs into those holes, and remove the remaining two bolts.

step1.para: Support the hydraulic pump and remove four bolts from the mount bracket.
Carefully lift the hydraulic pump up and clear of the engine.
If the hydraulic pump is being replaced, follow these instructions to disassemble the hydraulic pump:

item.para: Remove the hub mount nut from the hydraulic pump.
Using an appropriate puller, remove the hub from the hydraulic pump.
Note the location of two fittings and remove two fittings from hydraulic pump.
Remove nut, lock washer, and cable strap from mount bracket and hydraulic pump.
Remove two mount bolts, washers, and nuts from mount bracket and hydraulic pump.
Remove hydraulic pump from mount brackets.

step1.para: If the hydraulic pump is being replaced, follow these instructions to assemble the hydraulic pump:

item.para: Install the hydraulic pump on the mount brackets ( Figure 13, Items 2 and 7).
Install two mount bolts, washers, and nuts on the mount bracket and hydraulic pump ( Figure 13). Torque bolts to 70 to 85 lbf-ft (95 to 115 N•m).
Install the cable strap on the mount bracket and hydraulic pump. Secure the cable strap with the lock washer and nut ( Figure 13). Torque nut to 21 to 27 lbf-ft (28 to 37 N•m).
Install two fittings on hydraulic pump as noted during removal procedure ( Figure 13, Items 1 and 2).
Install the hub on the hydraulic pump and secure with hub mount nut ( Figure 13, Items 2, 5, and 6). Torque nut to 220 to 240 lbf-ft (298 to 325 N•m).

caution.para: The hydraulic pump weighs 77 lbs. (35 kg) and care should be taken when installing the hydraulic pump. The temperature sensor and wiring located under the hydraulic pump can be broken if the hydraulic pump is allowed to drop down.

step1.para: Carefully align the hydraulic pump and mount brackets on the two studs that were installed during the removal procedures.
Install two bolts on the mount bracket, remove two studs, and install two remaining bolts on the mount bracket ( Figure 12, Items 1, 3, and 4). Torque bolts to 17 to 21 lbf-ft (23 to 28 N•m).

caution.para: Some hydraulic hoses and fittings in the hydraulic system are equipped with O-rings to seal the hydraulic hoses. Inspect all O-rings prior to installation and replace as needed.

note.para: Be sure to remove all caps and plugs that were installed during the removal procedures before installing hydraulic hoses.

step1.para: Connect the upper hydraulic hose on the hydraulic pump ( Figure 12, Items 1 and 2).
Connect the lower hydraulic hose on the hydraulic pump ( Figure 12, Items 1 and 6).
Install P-clips and wire ties on the lower hydraulic hose as needed.
Install the hydraulic pump pulley on the hydraulic pump and secure with six bolts and washers ( Figure 11). Torque bolts to 13 to 16 lbf-ft (18 to 21 N•m).
Insert ratchet in belt tensioner release hole, relieve tension, and install drive belt on hydraulic pump pulley ( Figure 10). Ensure that the belt is properly mounted on all other pulleys.
Fill the hydraulic system.
Close and latch the rear compartment service doors, left-side door, and rear door.
